Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.observer.Observable<Controller>
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observer<Command>
public class Controller
extends Observable<Controller>
implements Observer<Command>
This class represents the Controller in MVC design pattern. The whole application, in fact, is based on MVC pattern, and in particular Controller class is View's observer. The "dialogue" between Controller and View is possible (mainly) through Command: this (abstract) class can represent a move/build that a Player wants to do during the game, or some initial information, ... This is the reason for Controller class to implement Observer (Command), since (as explained) View notifies Controller using Command as update message. Then, following MVC pattern, Controller invokes Model's methods to modify the model itself.

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller​(Model model)
      The constructor creates an instance of Controller class. This class needs to reference to the general Model of the game, so that changes and operations in it are possible.
      Parameters:
      model - class Model of MVC pattern

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentGamePhase

      GamePhase getCurrentGamePhase()
      This method is the getter for the current game-phase of the match.
      Returns:
      match's current game phase

    • getPlayers

      java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
      This method is the getter for the list of all players involved in the match.
      Returns:
      the list of players

    • getBoard

      Board getBoard()
      This method is the getter for the board of the match.
      Returns:
      match's board

    • update

      public void update​(Command command)
      This method is an overriding method of "update" in Observer interface. Its task is to handle players' commands coming from View.
      Specified by:
      update in interface Observer<Command>
      Parameters:
      command - player move/build from View

    • handleInitialInfoCommand

      void handleInitialInfoCommand​(InitialInfoCommand initialInfoCommand)
      This method handles an InitialInfoCommand. In particular, its main task is to set the chosen nickname and colour; then, the player's turn ends (with a possible change of game-phase, if everyone has already finished InitialInfo phase).
      Parameters:
      initialInfoCommand - command containing nickname and colour chosen by one of the players
      Throws:
      WrongPlayerException - if player who gave the command is not the current player
      NicknameAlreadyTakenException - if selected nickname has already been chosen by another player
      InvalidColorException - if selected colour has already been chosen by another player (or, for any other reason, is not in selectable's colour list)

    • handleGodChoiceCommand

      void handleGodChoiceCommand​(GodChoiceCommand godChoiceCommand)
      This method handles a GodChoiceCommand. In particular, its main task is to set the chosen god (or gods, if the player is god-chooser); then, the player's turn ends (with a possible change of game-phase, if everyone has already finished GodChoice phase).
      Parameters:
      godChoiceCommand - command containing the chosen god (not god-chooser player) or gods(god-chooser player)
      Throws:
      WrongPlayerException - if player who gave the command is not the current player
      InvalidGodException - if selected god is not in selectable's gods list

    • handleGamePreparationCommand

      void handleGamePreparationCommand​(GamePreparationCommand gamePreparationCommand)
      This method handles a GamePreparationCommand. In particular, its main task is to place workers in the specified positions; then, the player's turn ends (with a possible change of game-phase, if everyone has already finished GamePreparation phase).
      Parameters:
      gamePreparationCommand - command containing the positions chosen for the two workers
      Throws:
      WrongPlayerException - if player who gave the command is not the current player

    • handlePlayerCommand

      void handlePlayerCommand​(PlayerCommand playerCommand) throws WrongPlayerException
      This private method simply extends update's task, for PlayerCommand. In fact, to handle this command is necessary to: verify that the player who required it is game's current player (otherwise, there is no need to call the Model, since its state will not modify); call the selected command from the player, as an invocation of one of model's methods.
      Parameters:
      playerCommand - player command from View
      Throws:
      WrongPlayerException - when command's player is not current player

    • checkLoseConditionsMove

      private void checkLoseConditionsMove()
      This method checks if the current player has a possibility to move. In fact, if the current player needs to move but can't do it, he/she immediately loses the match: in this case, a proper method (which will notify all the players) is called.

    • checkLoseConditionsBuild

      private void checkLoseConditionsBuild​(PlayerCommand playerCommand)
      This method checks if the current player has a possibility to build. In fact, if the current player needs to build but can't do it, he/she immediately loses the match: in this case, a proper method (which will notify all the players) is called.
      Parameters:
      playerCommand - the last PlayerCommand executed

    • checkAllWinConstraints

      private boolean checkAllWinConstraints​(PlayerCommand playerCommand)
      This method checks all Player God's Win Constraints to check if there is a power which prevents the Player who executed the given PlayerCommand to win.
      Parameters:
      playerCommand - player command from View
      Returns:
      true if win is permitted, false otherwise.

    • checkAllGamePreparationConstraints

      private boolean checkAllGamePreparationConstraints​(GamePreparationCommand gamePreparationCommand, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> inhibitor)
      This method checks if a GamePreparationCommand is valid or not. A GamePreparationCommand can be not-valid when, for example, some rules (mainly related to god powers) are not respected.
      Parameters:
      gamePreparationCommand - the given command in GamePreparation Phase
      inhibitor - an empty map that, in case, is filled with the name and description of the god that does not allow the given command
      Returns:
      true if the command is valid, false otherwise

    • checkAllMoveConstraints

      private boolean checkAllMoveConstraints​(PlayerCommand playerCommand, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> inhibitor)
      This method checks all Player God's Move Constraints to check if there is a power which prevents the Player who executed the given PlayerCommand to move.
      Parameters:
      playerCommand - player command from View
      inhibitor - an empty map that, in case, is filled with the name and description of the god that does not allow the given command
      Returns:
      true if move is permitted, false otherwise

    • checkAllBuildConstraints

      private boolean checkAllBuildConstraints​(PlayerCommand playerCommand, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> inhibitor)
      This method checks all Player God's Build Constraints to check if there is a power which prevents the Player who executed the given PlayerCommand to build.
      Parameters:
      playerCommand - player command from View
      inhibitor - an empty map that, in case, is filled with the name and description of the god that does not allow the given command
      Returns:
      true if build is permitted, false otherwise

    • checkAllEndTurnConstraints

      private boolean checkAllEndTurnConstraints​(PlayerCommand playerCommand, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> inhibitor)
      This method checks if an End-Turn can be performed, or it is not allowed by some of the Player' gods.
      Parameters:
      playerCommand - player command from View
      inhibitor - an empty map that, in case, is filled with the name and description of the god that does not allow the given command
      Returns:
      true if end-turn is permitted, false otherwise

    • checkCanMoveOtherGodsConstraints

      private boolean checkCanMoveOtherGodsConstraints​(Player player)
      This method checks if one of the parameter-player's workers can move or not, related to other players' God Powers; in particular, some God's Powers can totally inhibit a player's possibility to move with one of his/her workers.
      Parameters:
      player - player during his/her turn
      Returns:
      true if move is permitted, false if denied by a God Power

    • checkCanBuildOtherGodsConstraints

      private boolean checkCanBuildOtherGodsConstraints​(Player player)
      This method checks if one of the parameter-player's workers can build or not, related to other players' God Powers; in particular, some God's Powers can totally inhibit a player's possibility to build with one of his/her workers.
      Parameters:
      player - player during his/her turn
      Returns:
      true if build is permitted, false if denied by a God Power

    • initialPhase

      public void initialPhase()
      This method is the entry point from Server class. A random starting-player and god-chooser are chosen, and the players are notified about the first turn of the match. This starting phase is followed by InitialInfo phase, where players choose their nicknames and colours.

    • godChoosePhase

      private void godChoosePhase()
      This method must be called when God Choice Phase starts. Every Player is notified in the proper way.

    • gamePreparationPhase

      private void gamePreparationPhase()
      This method must be called when Game Preparation Phase starts. Every Player is notified in the proper way.

    • startMatch

      private void startMatch()
      This method must be called when the real match starts. Every Player is notified in the proper way.

    • onPlayerDisconnected

      public void onPlayerDisconnected​(java.lang.String playerID)
      This method handles a disconnection from one of the clients involved in the match. In particular, when a Player disconnects, he/she is removed; then, everyone must be notified and the match immediately ends.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the ID of the Player that disconnected

    • onMatchWon

      private void onMatchWon()
      This method handles a victory by one of the players involved in the match.
